author: qhaleesi
title: SAVINGS CULTURE AMONG THE UNBANKED
description: Les personnes non bancarisées n'ont pas accès à des systèmes d'épargne conviviaux qui encouragent la micro-épargne régulière de 0,5 à 10 dollars par semaine/mois.

f6_assessments.q0:
Based on the solution provided it is unclear how this could be related to Cardano ecosystem, and how attractive will be this friendly savings system to the users having in mind that the fee for any transactions with ADA is around $.22 and the minimum threshold for savings is declared as $.50.

The proposal itself reads more like a desire than as a working project as it lacks in providing relevant information for implementation.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is not broken down into identifiable items thus making it difficult to assess if the requested amount is appropriate or not.

The proposal doesn't offer a realistic timetable to complete the work (what is to be done and how) and the proposer isn't aware of the all necessary resources that are of need for this project.

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation (what are the constrains for implementing this project? - as I wrote above, the transaction fee on ADA blockchain might be unattractive for some users)
f6_assessments.q2:
There is no roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement and no KPIs/metrics are defined to measure the success of this proposal (how many potential users can be onboarded? what is to be done to retain them? etc.)

The proposal itself reads very poorly. It reads like a concept more than an executable proposal. It needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. Perhaps reworking it and submitting it at the later stages will work.

f6_assessments.q0: Encouraging saving among the unbanked is important. However the proposal fails to show how it will tie in/work with the Cardano ecosystem. Futhermoe, I would like the team to rework the problem statement and solution as the two are disconnected from each other at the moment. Therefore the proposal does not address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: I would like to see short bios on the team and links to LinkedIn or similar to verify work history and qualifications. i would like to see the team to expand how the Cardano blockchain will be incorporated into their project. The path to success is not clear in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided no clear roadmap and line-item budget. I would like the team to recreate a detailed roadmap with milestones that are connected to the KPIs and budget, in this way the team can track performance vs. expenditure over time. Furthermore, I would like to see the team add measurable goals to the KPIs identified – create/sign up/ X number by Y date –, have 100 customers by month 1, have $10k saved on the platform by month 2, etc. As the proposal stands at the moment it will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: Likelemba Savings and Credit System is similar to Chit system practiced in few Asian countries and has been a micro-credit facility using community identity as the only security. This system is well understood by the local population and the use of decentralised identity can improve the functioning of this system in scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has attached photographs of the past community-powered savings scheme event as the reference. It is encouraging there is a need to have feet on real ground and this proposal will provide that in Congo for Atala and to unleash the power of decentralization. It will not be proper to demand proof of past work in this setting and trust the proposer in good faith based on the proposed project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has identified Province of Nord Kivu precisely MUGUNGA/SAKE/MINOVA/MASISI  as the target population for the project and has a workable plan. The budget breakdown is reasonable and does not contain any extra spending. The progress can easily be monitored based on measurable outputs on the ground.

f6_assessments.q0: Helping people save money is an effective way to grow their economy and reduce poverty for themselves. I really like the idea of this proposal. But I really haven't seen a concrete solution and a concrete plan for this idea. This seems like just an idea of wanting to use crypto to help people save $0.5-$10 weekly or monthly, but there is not really a concrete solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
"This proposal needs a clear description of what it would, how it would do it, when it would do it by, how the budget would be spent and evidence the proposer has the skills to deliver.
Although the proposer says they did a 600 members pilot savings project for community members to own solar powered brand new laptops and has a picture attached, I don't see an attached link to that project in the proposal. Besides, there is nothing about the program that makes me feel suspicious about the project.
A specific solution and plan and complete information about the project that you have implemented is what we need in this proposal."
f6_assessments.q2: No info has been provided to show how this project will solve the problems it wants to solve. There is no way to track the progress or success of this project. Providing goals at certain points in time is a great way to measure the progress and success of your project.

solution: L'épargne est mise en commun et échangée sur les marchés cryptographiques afin de lever des fonds pour les moyens de subsistance, l'énergie solaire et le logement. L'objectif est de leur fournir une identité numérique.
experience: En 2017, nous avons réalisé un projet pilote d'épargne de 600 membres pour que les membres de la communauté puissent posséder des ordinateurs portables neufs à énergie solaire.  ++PHOTOS JOINTES.++
